specs: Service Shop is a cloud-native microservices demo for an online shopping platform. It includes services for managing product catalog, recommendations, shopping assistant, shipping, email notifications, and other supporting infrastructure.
user_stories:
- As a customer, I want to browse the product catalog so that I can choose items to purchase.
- As a customer, I want to add items to my cart with help from a shopping assistant service.
- As a customer, I want to receive product recommendations so that I can discover relevant items.
- As a customer, I want to check out and place orders for the items in my cart.
- As a customer, I want to receive confirmation emails after placing orders.
- As a customer, I want to choose from various shipping options during checkout.
- As a system, I want to manage inventory for each product in the catalog.
- As a customer, I want to view my order history and track the status of shipments.
- As an admin, I want to update product details and manage catalog listings.
- As a system, I want to send personalized promotional emails based on user preferences.
- As a system, I want to handle customer inquiries using the shopping assistant service.
- As a customer, I want to review products and provide feedback after purchase.
- As an admin, I want to monitor order trends and generate sales reports.
- As a customer, I want to apply discount codes during checkout.

microservices.name: Product Catalog Service

endpoints.name: /products
endpoints.description: Retrieves list of products from catalog with optional filtering and pagination

endpoints.name: /products/{product_id}
endpoints.description: Retrieves detailed information about a specific product

endpoints.name: /products
endpoints.description: Creates a new product in the catalog (admin only)

endpoints.name: /products/{product_id}
endpoints.description: Updates existing product details (admin only)

endpoints.name: /products/{product_id}
endpoints.description: Removes a product from the catalog (admin only)

endpoints.name: /products/{product_id}/inventory
endpoints.description: Retrieves current inventory level for a product

endpoints.name: /products/{product_id}/inventory
endpoints.description: Updates inventory level for a product

user_stories: As a customer, I want to browse the product catalog so that I can choose items to purchase.
As a system, I want to manage inventory for each product in the catalog.
As an admin, I want to update product details and manage catalog listings.
microservices.description: Manages product information, catalog listings, inventory levels, and product details. Handles CRUD operations for products.

microservices.name: Shopping Cart Service

endpoints.name: /cart/{customer_id}
endpoints.description: Retrieves all items in a customer's shopping cart

endpoints.name: /cart/{customer_id}/items
endpoints.description: Adds an item to the shopping cart

endpoints.name: /cart/{customer_id}/items/{cart_item_id}
endpoints.description: Updates quantity of an item in the cart

endpoints.name: /cart/{customer_id}/items/{cart_item_id}
endpoints.description: Removes an item from the shopping cart

endpoints.name: /cart/{customer_id}/clear
endpoints.description: Clears all items from the shopping cart

user_stories: As a customer, I want to add items to my cart with help from a shopping assistant service.
microservices.description: Manages shopping cart operations including adding, removing, and updating items in customer carts.

microservices.name: Recommendation Service

endpoints.name: /recommendations/{customer_id}
endpoints.description: Retrieves personalized product recommendations for a customer

endpoints.name: /recommendations/popular
endpoints.description: Retrieves popular products across all customers

endpoints.name: /recommendations/similar/{product_id}
endpoints.description: Retrieves products similar to a given product

user_stories: As a customer, I want to receive product recommendations so that I can discover relevant items.
microservices.description: Provides personalized product recommendations based on customer behavior and preferences using materialized views.

microservices.name: Order Service

endpoints.name: /orders
endpoints.description: Creates a new order from the shopping cart and initiates checkout process

endpoints.name: /orders/{order_id}
endpoints.description: Retrieves detailed information about a specific order

endpoints.name: /orders/customer/{customer_id}
endpoints.description: Retrieves order history for a customer

endpoints.name: /orders/{order_id}/status
endpoints.description: Retrieves current status and tracking information for an order

endpoints.name: /orders/{order_id}/cancel
endpoints.description: Cancels an existing order

endpoints.name: /orders/discount/validate
endpoints.description: Validates a discount code and returns discount details

endpoints.name: /orders/reports/sales
endpoints.description: Generates sales reports for admin monitoring (admin only)

user_stories: As a customer, I want to check out and place orders for the items in my cart.
As a customer, I want to view my order history and track the status of shipments.
As a customer, I want to apply discount codes during checkout.
As an admin, I want to monitor order trends and generate sales reports.
microservices.description: Handles order placement, checkout process, order history, discount code application, and order status tracking with event sourcing for audit trail.

microservices.name: Shipping Service

endpoints.name: /shipping/options
endpoints.description: Retrieves available shipping options with costs for a destination

endpoints.name: /shipping/calculate
endpoints.description: Calculates shipping cost for specific items and destination

endpoints.name: /shipping/shipment
endpoints.description: Creates a new shipment for an order

endpoints.name: /shipping/track/{tracking_number}
endpoints.description: Tracks shipment status using tracking number

endpoints.name: /shipping/shipment/{shipment_id}/status
endpoints.description: Updates shipment status (internal use)

user_stories: As a customer, I want to choose from various shipping options during checkout.
As a customer, I want to view my order history and track the status of shipments.
microservices.description: Manages shipping options, calculates shipping costs, and tracks shipment status.

microservices.name: Notification Service

endpoints.name: /notifications/send
endpoints.description: Sends a notification to a customer

endpoints.name: /notifications/{notification_id}/status
endpoints.description: Retrieves status of a sent notification

endpoints.name: /notifications/preferences/{customer_id}
endpoints.description: Retrieves notification preferences for a customer

endpoints.name: /notifications/preferences/{customer_id}
endpoints.description: Updates notification preferences for a customer

endpoints.name: /notifications/promotional
endpoints.description: Sends promotional emails to a target customer segment

user_stories: As a customer, I want to receive confirmation emails after placing orders.
As a system, I want to send personalized promotional emails based on user preferences.
microservices.description: Sends order confirmation emails, promotional emails, and other customer notifications based on domain events and preferences.

microservices.name: Shopping Assistant Service

endpoints.name: /assistant/chat
endpoints.description: Handles customer chat messages and provides intelligent responses

endpoints.name: /assistant/conversation/{conversation_id}
endpoints.description: Retrieves conversation history for a customer

endpoints.name: /assistant/suggest-products
endpoints.description: Suggests products based on customer queries and preferences

endpoints.name: /assistant/add-to-cart
endpoints.description: Adds suggested products to cart from assistant recommendations

user_stories: As a system, I want to handle customer inquiries using the shopping assistant service.
As a customer, I want to add items to my cart with help from a shopping assistant service.
microservices.description: Provides intelligent assistance for shopping decisions and handles customer inquiries through conversational interface.

microservices.name: Review Service

endpoints.name: /reviews/product/{product_id}
endpoints.description: Retrieves all reviews for a specific product

endpoints.name: /reviews
endpoints.description: Submits a new product review

endpoints.name: /reviews/{review_id}
endpoints.description: Retrieves details of a specific review

endpoints.name: /reviews/{review_id}
endpoints.description: Updates an existing review

endpoints.name: /reviews/{review_id}
endpoints.description: Deletes a review

endpoints.name: /reviews/customer/{customer_id}
endpoints.description: Retrieves all reviews submitted by a customer

endpoints.name: /reviews/{review_id}/helpful
endpoints.description: Marks a review as helpful or not helpful

user_stories: As a customer, I want to review products and provide feedback after purchase.
microservices.description: Manages product reviews, ratings, and customer feedback after purchase.

patterns.explaination: I chose database per service pattern because the context explicitly recommends this approach for all services to ensure loose coupling, independent scalability, and allow each service to choose optimal database technology for its needs. Each service maintains its own data and is responsible for its own persistence.

I chose the saga pattern because the context identifies the order checkout flow as requiring distributed transaction coordination across multiple services: Order Service creates the order, Product Catalog Service reduces inventory, Shipping Service creates shipment, and Notification Service sends confirmation. If any step fails (e.g., insufficient inventory), compensating transactions can rollback the order, ensuring data consistency across services.

I chose API composition pattern because the context recommends it for queries spanning multiple services. When retrieving order history with complete details, the Order Service needs to combine its order data with product details from Product Catalog Service and shipping information from Shipping Service to provide comprehensive order information to customers.

I chose API composition pattern because the context specifically mentions aggregating Product Catalog Service data with Review Service ratings to show complete product information including reviews and ratings on product pages.

I chose API composition pattern because the context identifies the checkout summary as requiring combination of data from Shopping Cart Service (cart items), Shipping Service (shipping costs), and Order Service (discount validation) to provide complete checkout information.

I chose CQRS pattern because the context recommends it for complex queries and reporting, specifically mentioning admin sales reports. This creates a read-optimized view that aggregates data from Order Service, Product Catalog Service, and Review Service for trend analysis, separating the complex read model from the write model.

I chose CQRS pattern because the context specifically recommends maintaining a materialized view combining customer behavior, order history, and product catalog for the Recommendation Service. This allows efficient read operations for recommendation generation while keeping the write models in their respective services.

I chose domain event pattern because the context identifies 'Order Placed Event' as triggering multiple actions across services: Notification Service sends confirmation email, Shipping Service creates shipment, and Product Catalog Service updates inventory. This enables loose coupling and event-driven communication.

I chose domain event pattern because the context mentions 'Product Review Added Event' which updates product ratings in Product Catalog Service and potentially triggers promotional campaigns via Notification Service, demonstrating event-driven communication between services.

I chose domain event pattern because the context identifies 'Inventory Low Event' from Product Catalog Service to notify admins through Notification Service, showing event-driven communication for system alerts.

I chose aggregate pattern because the context specifically recommends treating Order with its line items, payment info, and status as a single aggregate root in Order Service to maintain data consistency within the service boundary and ensure transactional integrity.

I chose aggregate pattern because the context recommends managing product details, inventory, and catalog listings as a cohesive unit in Product Catalog Service to ensure consistency within the service boundary.
I chose aggregate pattern because the context recommends managing cart items as a transactional boundary in Shopping Cart Service to ensure all cart operations maintain consistency.

I chose event sourcing pattern because the context recommends it for Order Service to store all order state changes as events, providing a complete audit trail and ability to reconstruct order history. This is essential for order tracking and compliance requirements.

I chose event sourcing pattern because the context recommends tracking all cart modifications as events for analytics and abandoned cart recovery in Shopping Cart Service, enabling detailed behavioral analysis.

datastore.description: Stores product information, catalog listings, inventory levels, and product details. Supports user stories for browsing catalog, managing inventory, and updating product details. Uses aggregate pattern to maintain product consistency.

Stores customer shopping cart items and cart state. Implements event sourcing to track all cart modifications for analytics and abandoned cart recovery. Supports user story for adding items to cart with shopping assistant.

Stores recommendation algorithms, customer preferences, and materialized views combining customer behavior and order history. Implements CQRS pattern with read-optimized views for efficient recommendation generation. Supports user story for personalized recommendations.

Stores order information, order history, discount codes, and payment details using event sourcing for complete audit trail. Maintains order aggregates for consistency. Supports user stories for checkout, order history, discount codes, and sales reporting. Includes both event store for sourcing and read models for CQRS queries.
Stores shipping options, costs, shipment tracking information, and delivery status. Supports user stories for choosing shipping options and tracking shipments.

Stores notification logs, customer notification preferences, email templates, and delivery status. Supports user stories for order confirmation emails and personalized promotional emails based on preferences.
Stores conversation history, customer context, and interaction logs for the shopping assistant. Supports user stories for handling customer inquiries and assisting with cart additions.

Stores product reviews, ratings, customer feedback, and helpful votes. Supports user story for reviewing products and providing feedback after purchase. Generates domain events when reviews are added.
